definitions: (with reference to a device or process) by itself with little or no direct human control

examples.text: the kettle automatically switched off when it boiled

shortDefinitions: by itself with little or no direct human control

definitions: (with reference to a firearm) continuously until the ammunition is exhausted or the pressure on the trigger is released

examples.text: the recovered weapons had been illegally modified to fire fully automatically

shortDefinitions: continuously until ammunition is exhausted or trigger released

definitions: without conscious thought or attention; spontaneously

examples.text: although I used my best Italian, the receptionists automatically replied in English

shortDefinitions: spontaneously, without conscious thought or attention

definitions: as a necessary and inevitable result of a fixed rule or particular set of circumstances

examples.text: the winners of the Division 2 final are not automatically promoted

shortDefinitions: as necessary and inevitable result of fixed rule
